description: A collection of circles in a large trapezoidal formation; there is a smaller trapezoidal formation extending upwards from the top, a small circular formation below the center of the larger trapezoidal formation, and a triangular formation extending downwards from the bottom right corner of the larger trapezoidal formation. Each circle has a different number in the center denoting how many lines stem from that point. There is a large pale yellow triangle in the top left corner of the large trapezoidal formation and a dark brown triangle on the right side of the small circular formation.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
